result.execSummary:
All charges against Naihla L. Buckley in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Naihla L. Buckley is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Naihla L. Buckley

records.addlTxt:
8:19 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Naihla L. Buckley in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Naihla L. Buckley.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 21CF694, 21CF795, 21CF858, 21CF900, 21CM458, 22CF67, 22CF224, 22CF248.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine in 21CF858, NC to Ct 1- Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer in 21CF900, & NC to Ct 1- Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer in 22CF67.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in files 21CF858, 21CF900, & 22CF67. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 21CF858, Ct 2-5 in 21CF900, Ct 2-5 in 22CF67, 21CF694, 21CF795, 21CM458, 22CF224 & 22CF248 with prejudice.  Bond money on file is on cases 21CM458, 22CF67, & 22CF224. Sentencing arguments. Court reserves on credit, attorneys to update the Court by 9/7/22.  

Court Orders: Ct 1- 21CF858

S/W 3 Years  Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $268.00  
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Court Orders: Ct 1- 21CF900

S/W 3 Years  Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $268.00     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Court Orders: Ct 1- 22CF67

S/W 3 Years  Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $268.00     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- Complete mental health evaluation and follow through
- AODA and follow through 
- Test randomly and regularly 
- Absolute sobriety
- Apology letters to Officer J. Hemker and Sgt L. Dohmeier
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation today 9/6/22, DE to be taken to treatment program immediately after signing up for probation, no stops along the way. 

Adjourned at 9:13 AM 

Back on record at 9:45 AM- DE can not get into treatment until tomorrow 9/7/22, DE to be held in custody until tomorrow, sign up for probation and immediately report to treatment program.  No stops along the way. Adjourned at 9:46 AM. bph
for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Request Modification. Filed by DE. arc    Per SRN, Reviewed. arc  c: DA and DE Atty
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Per SRN. arc

11:10  AM Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel.   ADA:   Erica Ellenwood w/Matthew Connor Smith   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Naihla L. Buckley appeared from jail.  INCLUDES:  21CF694, 21CF795, 21CF858, 21CF900, 21CM458, 22CF67. Atty Harrelson states parties are discussing settlement, DE has applied to a residential treatment program, could complete intake at facility if provided transportation as early as 6/2. Atty Ellenwood is hesitant to modify a bond. Court will take up bond at next hearing. If not a plea, will set for trial. Court notes K. Rheingans in court and makes statements on DE's behalf. Case also calls 22CF224 and 22CF248 that had been set with Branch IV today. Adjourned:  11:21 am  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

11:40 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF:  Naihla L. Buckley appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF67 (STC) and 22CF248 (ARGN). Atty. Harrelson requests substitution of judge on 22CF248, discovery has been received, offer has been received but not accepted, does not anticipate motions, requests additional time to obtain police reports. Court notes that 22CF248 will likely be assigned to Branch 3 or 4. 22CF248 (ARGN): Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. Court notes request for substitution of judge was filed timely. Atty. Harrelson requests 30 days. Court instructs that all Branch 3 cases should be scheduled for next hearing. Adjourned: 11:48 AM. kma
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:27 AM CO: TCH for SJN, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: S. Fox, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson,  DF:  Naihla L. Buckley appeared from jail. S/T Officer  C. Tomlinson. Direct by ADA E. Ellenwood. Cross by Atty J. Harrelson. Court takes judicial notice of the bond in 22CF67.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Ellenwood notes INFO has been filed. Atty Harrelson requests ARGN to be heard on another day.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Harrelson. arc
Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sharon Hart and Valu Stay Motel in River Falls, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:00 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY: Intern Kaitlin Dippolito with Travis Satorius for today, DF: Naihla L. Buckley appeared from jail. DE qualifies for public defender, Atty. Harrelson has already been appointed.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. ADA Rockow requests bond. Atty. Dippolito makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Atty. Dippolito requests PH within time limits. Court sets PH. Tina from JSC states that DE needs to charge GPS upon release, DE has not been testing with JSC. Adjourned: 1:18 PM. kma  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:09 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Naihla L. Buckley did not appear from jail. Set for INIT. DE refused to be booked into jail to appear today. Court reviews other pending cases. Court adjourns today's hearing and resets until tomorrow. Adjourned: 1:13 PM. kma  Initial appearance scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
